result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Lorge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

RH  1/8/19 at 1:30 pm

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 1 - 30 months
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Within 5 days of agreement, shall schedule an assessment for alcohol or other drug abuse, complete assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Within 30 days of agreement, shall make arrangements to participate in a sex offender treatment program as approved by DA's office - Successfully complete and pay for program
Shall have no unsupervised contact with the victim named in the complaint.  Supervision can consist of another adult being present in the home when the victim is there
Within 5 days after first contact with each provider, execute any and all written releases to allow counseling or care providers to discuss the assessment, counseling or treatment programs with DA's Office
Shall file with the DA's Office a monthly written report certifying compliance with conditions/requirements
Provide DA's office with all written proof of full compliance with this agreement
If complies - amend to Battery 940.19(1) class A misdemeanor and pay costs
Non-compliance - formal sentencing
Bond continued
Plea hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
